ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It is a good choice if you have some introductory quantum mechanics background.
I enjoyed this course very much and I'll definitely recommend it to other students who are interested in theoretical chemistry, physical chemistry and computational chemistry.

Applying quantum mechanics to chemical problems. I would recommend this course to other physical chemistry or physics students. After being introduced to wavefunctions, etc. it is nice to see how they are used.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This gave a great review of numerical methods for molecular dynamics simulation. Understanding of this material is core to my sub-discipline.

This course has greatly deepened my knowledge in theories in quantum mechanics and its state-of-the-art applications in quantum chemistry calculations, the field I am interested in and plan to work on in my graduate research.

I know have a better understanding of what semi-classical methods are, so I can understand some more of the research that I may hear about. The course material does not directly affect my research, but it helps me become a better thinker.
